body_html:
Yes, the problem persists. Note that in a normal python shell it might not show the exception (because the process is terminating) but it will show INFO:tensorflow:Coordinator stopped with threads still running: Thread-1 (since the root logger level has been set to INFO).

Adding, for instance, time.sleep(5) after closing the session will always show the exception using a normal python shell.

In my code, I made sure to finalize everything before closing the session, so all this is not really a problem for me right now, but I thought it was worth reporting it.

Adding, for instance, time.sleep(5) after closing the session will always show the exception using a normal python shell.

body:
Yes, the problem persists. Note that in a normal python shell it might not show the exception (because the process is terminating) but it will show `INFO:tensorflow:Coordinator stopped with threads still running: Thread-1`  (since the root logger level has been set to INFO).

Adding, for instance, `time.sleep(5)` after closing the session will always show the exception using a normal python shell. 

In my code, I made sure to finalize everything before closing the session, so all this is not really a problem for me right now, but I thought it was worth reporting it.
